title.rendered: How to put accents in Word

content.rendered:
we will explain how to put accents in word, something that will also work for the rest of Windows 10 and any other application you have installed. There are times that the language of your operating system is misconfigured or that you are using a keyboard with a non-Spanish layout that does not have accents, so it does not hurt to know the alternative method to be able to put it on the vowels.

We are going to start the article by telling you the key combinations with which you can write accented vowels in Windows you have the keyboard you have and regardless of the language settings there are. Then, just in case, we will also tell you how to put the keyboard in Spanish in Windows.

How to put accents with your keyboard

The first key combination is the best known, and is to press the accent button to the right of the letter Ñ. When you press that ´button, no sign will appear, but it will wait for you to press the next button. For example, if you press ´ + u the result will be ú. This is the classic method, although it is not the only one with which you can write accents.

If your keyboard doesn’t have this button, you have other key combinations available. in all of them you have to hold down the Alt key and type a combination of numbers so that when you later release the Alt key, an accented vowel appears. The Alt is the button that is usually below, to the left of the space bar. These are the combinations:

  • ALT + 160: a
  • ALT + 130: he
  • ALT + 161: yes
  • ALT + 162: either
  • ALT + 163: or

Add the Spanish language to your keyboard

Now we are going to remind you how to add the Spanish language to your keyboard. First enter the Windows Settings, and in it click on the Time and language option. In these settings is where you can change from the date of your computer to everything related to the language you are using, both in the operating system itself and on the keyboard.

Once you are inside the Time and language menu of Windows settings, Click on the Language section (1) that will appear in the third place in the column on the left. Once inside this section, scroll down to the Preferred Languages ​​section and click on the Add a preferred language button (2) in case you don’t see that Spanish is there.

A new window will open called Choose a language to install. In her, use the search engine to locate and select Spanish, and then click the Next button. You will go to a second step in which you must check the Set as display language box to give it visibility in the favorites. Then, click on the Install button which you will see at the bottom of the screen.

When a language is in the favorites list, selecting it will show you icons with arrows to organize it according to preferencesbeing able to put it on top to give it more priority when writing or using the voice.

Once you have the Spanish language installed, by having two languages, a language selection button will appear on the taskbar, specifically on the right side next to the clock. When you click on that button, a window will open in which You can now select Spanish as the keyboard languageand by doing so you will immediately have the Spanish distribution.
